title: Drawing, "Torrance: Dresser", March 3, 1937
medium: Graphite, black ink, red and blue color pencil on tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/630 FIFTH AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite in stamp, lower right: 8723/F.S./TORRANCE, OLSSON/DILLM./D./3./3./37, 3/6/37, 1, MASTER.; inscribed in graphite, left of stamp: 1 DRESSERS 46" LONG-20" DEEP-36" HIGH/MYRTLE BURL & BLEACHED WHITE SYCAMORE/INTERIOR BLEACHED MAPLE/THREE DRAWERS ON EXT. SLIDES/USE YOUR STANDARD DRAWERS INTERIOR (DIVIDER ETC.)/USE DOMES OF SILENCE/VENEER ALL EXPOSED EDGES, TOP EDGES OF DRAWERS/PULLS BLEACHED SYCAMORE; dimensions, instructions, materials in graphite
description: Perspective, plan, and elevation drawing for dresser. Rounded front corners, squared back corners. Three stacked drawers at center with two horizontal pulls at left and right of each drawer. Top, sides, and base in myrtle burl, drawers and pulls in bleached white sycamore.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Torrance: Dresser", March 3, 1937.
March 3, 1937. Graphite, black ink, red and blue color pencil on tracing paper. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-929.
